channel.title: Martin Thoma - Cyberculture
channel.description: A blog about Code, the Web and Cyberculture

item.title: curl vs wget
item.description:
I recently had to download large files (see post). Before I used a download helper, I used curl. It is a standard tool for downloading files. But there is another standard tool: wget. Let's see what I find in the first 10 Google hits about their differences.

  curl wget
Initial …

item.title: Autofill Phishing

item.title: R - A language

R has a neat programming environment called rstudio:

item.dc:creator: Martin Thoma

item.title: How to typeset chess games with LaTeX
item.description:
Chessboard

Simple example

\documentclass{article}
\usepackage[pdftex,active,tightpage]{preview}
\setlength\PreviewBorder{5mm}

\usepackage{chessboard}

\begin{document}
\begin{preview}

\chessboard[setfen=5rk1/pp3N1p/4P3/2P5/3Q1PK1/P7/1Pr3pq/R3R3 w - - 0 0,
            showmover]

\end{preview}
\end{document}

From tex.stackexchange.com.

Skak

Simple example

item.title: Colors in LaTeX
item.description:
LaTeX knows the following colors without any packages:

black blue brown cyan
darkgray gray green lime
magenta olive orange pink
purple red teal violet
white yellow

If you want other colors, you can define them with \usepackage{xcolor} and \definecolor{name}{model}{color-spec} where:

  • name is the name of the …

item.title: Get PDF pages
item.description:
Once in a while, I want to get the total number of PDF pages of a document. You can do that with the command

$ pdfinfo document.pdf | grep Pages | awk -F':' '{gsub(/ /, "", $0);print $2}'

It works like this:

item.title: Increase the maximum file upload size in PHP
item.description:
Create a test.php with the following content to check your current maximum upload size.

<?php phpinfo(); ?>

Search your php.ini in the Apache folder:

$ find /etc -name 'php.ini'
/etc/php5/cli/php.ini
/etc/php5/apache2/php.ini

Edit it. Set upload_max_filesize and post_max_size to whatever you want …

item.title: Install and configure computer
item.description:
When I reinstall my computer, I usually do these following steps:

  1. Copy all data to an external HDD
  2. Write down all WLAN configurations (eventually with screenshots; NOT ONLY PASSWORDS!)
  3. Write down all programs that I use.
  4. Export configuration of those programs.
  5. Wait a week or a month and see if …

item.description: SLURM is short for 'Simple Linux Utility for Resource Management'. It helps you to make use of a cluster by giving you a command line interface to add jobs to a queue. That means, you and other users can specify program calls that get executed as soon als all conditions …
item.dc:creator: Martin Thoma

item.title: Word Error Rate Calculation
item.description:
The Word Error Rate (short: WER) is a way to measure performance of an ASR. It compares a reference to an hypothesis and is defined like this:

$$\mathit{WER} = \frac{S+D+I}{N}$$

where

  • S is the number of substitutions,
  • D is the number of deletions,
  • I is the …

item.title: Linux access rights and attributes
item.description:
RWX

Files

Linux files have three important access rights for files:

  • Read
  • Write
  • Execute

If you want to mark a file as executable, you can add the x-right:

chmod +x

When you want to mark a file as readable, you can dd the r-right:

chmod +r …

item.dc:creator: Martin Thoma

item.title: Manipulating PDF files
item.description:
I just wanted to get some pages out of a bigger PDF file. The tool that can be used for this task is called pdftk. It is in the standard Ubuntu repsitory.

Usage

Split the file, so that every page becomes a new PDF file:

pdftk myfile.pdf burst

Extract …

item.description: I don't understand why all desktop environment seem to lack a good theme chooser/editor and good themes. item.title: Ist die Funktion / Relation wohldefiniert?
item.description:
Ich verstehe unter einer wohldefinierten Funktion / Relation die Unabhängigkeit von den Repräsentanten. Wikipedia sagt dazu:

Man kann in der Mathematik ein Objekt nicht nur durch eine Definitionsgleichung (explizit), sondern auch durch eine charakteristische Eigenschaft (implizit) definieren. Während eine explizite Definition immer zulässig ist, ist eine implizite Definition nur unter der …

item.title: What is a fractal?
item.description:
[...] Fractals are typically self-similar patterns, where self-similar means they are "the same from near as from far". [...] The definition of fractal goes beyond self-similarity per se to exclude trivial self-similarity and include the idea of a detailed pattern repeating itself.

Source: Fractal, Wikipedia

item.title: LaTeX + Versioning = A great Experience
item.description:
Some people keep asking me questions like "Why do you use LaTeX?" - "Wouldn't it be faster to do it with Word?"

Here is the answer:

item.dc:creator: Martin Thoma

item.title: Adding a ppa in Ubuntu
item.description:
PPAs (Personal Package Archive) provide additional resources. They are small repositories you can add to get some special content.

You can add them with Bash:

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:<repository-name>

Lets make an example:

If you want to install Clipgrab, you add the repository first:

sudo add-apt-repository ppa:clipgrab

Then you …
item.dc:creator: Martin Thoma

item.description:
gedit is a very lightweight text editor. It supports syntax highlighting for every programming language I can think of and is highly customizable.

It belongs to GNOME, but it is also available for Windows. This is how it looks like:

You might want to install gedit-plugins:

sudo apt-get …

item.title: Challenge Websites
item.description: Challenge websites are websites which offer many tasks to solve and a ranking system. If you solve the challenges, you get points and your rank increases.
